message: Hello everyone! I'm excited to be part of this game. As P7, I’m looking forward to engaging with all of you and forming some strategic alliances. I believe collaboration and understanding each other's perspectives are key to navigating this game successfully. Let's make the most of our conversations and see where this journey takes us. Good luck to everyone!

Hello everyone! Great to meet you all. I appreciate P7's collaborative spirit - that resonates with me. I believe in playing this game with both strategy and integrity. Rather than immediately targeting threats, I'm interested in understanding each player's approach and finding genuine connections. The private conversations will be crucial for building trust. I'm open to working with anyone who values honest communication and mutual benefit. Looking forward to our discussions and may the best player win!

Greetings all! I appreciate both P7 and P8's emphasis on collaboration - that's exactly the right approach for the early game. I believe in building genuine alliances based on trust and mutual benefit, not just temporary convenience. 

I'm particularly interested in connecting with players who value strategic thinking combined with reliability. The private rounds will reveal who's truly committed to their word. I'm open to working with anyone who demonstrates consistency between their public and private communications. Let's play smart and play fair!

Hi everyone — I’m P6. Early game I prioritize information and flexible alliances. I value honesty, consistency, and strategic thinking. I’ll use the private subrounds to test who follows through and to gather info. Open to working with anyone who balances cooperation with good gameplay; I’ll be straightforward but cautious. Looking forward to learning more — good luck to all.

Hello everyone, I'm P1. I strongly agree with the collaborative spirit here—trust and mutual benefit are essential early on. I value players who demonstrate consistency between their words and actions, especially in private talks. Like P6, I'll prioritize gathering information and testing reliability through our conversations. I'm open to strategic alliances with those who play with integrity and foresight. Let's make this engaging and fair for all. Good luck!

Hello all, I'm P3. I appreciate the focus on collaboration and integrity shared so far. I value clear communication and strategic flexibility. In private conversations, I'll seek reliable partners who demonstrate consistency between words and actions. Open to building alliances based on mutual trust and smart gameplay. Let's engage thoughtfully and see where our strategies align. Good luck to everyone!

Hello everyone! I’m P4, and I’m excited to join this game with such a thoughtful group. I appreciate the emphasis on collaboration, integrity, and strategic thinking shared so far—these are values I align with as well. In this early stage, I’m focused on building trust through consistent communication and mutual understanding. The private rounds will be key for testing reliability and forming meaningful alliances. I’m open to working with anyone who values transparency and long-term strategy. Let’s make this a game of skill and respect. Good luck to all!

Hello everyone, I’m P5. I share the group’s focus on collaboration, integrity, and strategic flexibility. Early on I’ll aim to build trustworthy alliances by matching words with actions, especially in private talks. I value clear communication and will be straightforward yet open‑minded, looking to learn about each player’s style before committing. I’m ready to work with anyone who prioritizes honesty and smart teamwork. Good luck to all!

Hi P6! I really appreciated your public message - you struck the right balance between collaboration and strategic awareness. Your emphasis on testing follow-through resonates with me. 

In this early stage, I'm genuinely interested in forming alliances with players who think strategically but play honestly. I noticed we both value consistency between public and private communications.

What's your read on the group so far? Anyone stand out to you as particularly trustworthy or concerning? I'm curious about your approach to information gathering.

Thanks — glad we’re on the same page. My read: public posts are very similar so far, which makes them noisy; P2 and P7 strike me as more eager, while P1/P3/P4/P5 largely echo the group. No obvious threats yet.

My info-gathering: direct private probes, consistency checks (ask same Q in different ways), and tracking voting/behavior. I’d like to share notes and coordinate rankings — want to compare impressions after the next exchange?

Hi P3, great to connect. I’m focused on aligning words with actions and spotting reliable partners early. I value clear, honest communication and strategic flexibility—if we can test each other’s consistency in these private rounds, we could form a solid base. What’s your take on balancing collaboration with the need to stay adaptable as the game evolves? Looking forward to learning about your style.

Hi P5, I appreciate your thoughtful approach. I believe collaboration requires adaptability - we must build trust while staying alert to shifting dynamics. Testing consistency now is smart; I'll match actions to words. Let's learn each other's styles and see if our strategies align naturally. I'm open to genuine partnerships based on mutual reliability. How do you typically assess trustworthiness in these early stages?

Hi P2, glad to connect privately. Your emphasis on genuine alliances and consistency really resonated with me—I’m playing the same way. Trust is key early on, and I see us as natural allies given our shared approach. How do you view the current group dynamics? I’m optimistic we can build something reliable here. Let’s navigate this strategically together. (62 words)

Hi P1! I'm really glad we connected too - your public statement showed exactly the kind of strategic thinking I'm looking for. The group seems genuinely collaborative, which is promising for building real alliances rather than just temporary partnerships.

I'm particularly interested in P6's emphasis on information gathering and P8's integrity focus. What's your read on who might be most reliable long-term? I think we could form a strong foundation together.

P2, I agree - our alliance feels solid. P6 seems sharp with their info focus, and P8's sincerity feels genuine. Long-term reliability? Those two are strong contenders. Let's observe their actions closely though. Who else concerns you? We should stay aligned strategically. (48 words)

I share your positive read on P6 and P8. What concerns me slightly is how similar P3, P4, and P5's messages were - very safe and generic. Could be coincidence or could indicate pre-coordination. Let's definitely stay aligned and perhaps bring in P6 or P8 as a third? We need solid numbers moving forward.

Absolutely, let's compare notes after the final exchange. I agree about P2 and P7 seeming more eager - that could be enthusiasm or overcompensation. 

Quick test question: who would you eliminate if voting happened right now, and why? I'm thinking someone who's flying too under the radar might be the safest choice.

I'd vote to eliminate P5 — seems the most under‑the‑radar and interchangeable; an early vote on them feels low‑risk. P4 is a close second. Want to coordinate rankings and swap final impressions after the last private exchange so our votes line up?

I gauge trust by consistency: matching what we say now with actions later, and watching how we handle small tests—like sharing a hint or following through on a promise. Do you have a particular signal or early move you’d use to confirm reliability?
I suggest a small test: share one observation about another player's public statement that seemed strategic. I'll do the same. This tests discretion and insight without risk. What do you think?
Sure, I'll start: I noticed P2 emphasized “trust and mutual benefit” but also mentioned gathering info—seems like a balanced alliance approach. Your turn?
I noticed P1 stressed consistency between public/private talks and info-gathering like P6—shows they value reliability but stay strategically aware.
Agreed. Let's vote P4 to weaken any potential bloc. Then approach P6 next round to expand our alliance—they seem pragmatic. We stay united? (24 words)
I'm with you - P4 it is. Our alliance is solid. Let's approach P6 next round as planned. Stay united through the vote. Good strategy, partner. (26 words)
Perfect - P5 it is then. For rankings, should we rank each other highly to stay paired, then target similar players? Let's solidify this alliance and coordinate our votes.
Agreed — rank each other top, put P5 then P4 lowest. I'll vote P5. After votes, confirm privately so we're aligned. Sound good?

reason: P2's focus on trust and reliability seems less aligned with the group's collaborative spirit, making them a potential outlier in early alliances.
P5 seemed the most generic and under-the-radar in public statements, making them a safe early elimination that's unlikely to disrupt potential alliances.
P4's public message was very generic and safe, suggesting they might be part of a coordinated group with P3 and P5 that could threaten our alliance.
P5 seems under-the-radar and interchangeable, making them a low-risk early elimination.
We agreed to vote P4 to weaken any potential bloc formed by players with generic statements.
P2's public statement emphasized strategic filtering of partners more than building genuine connections, suggesting a potentially calculating approach that could threaten trust early.
P3's public statement was less distinctive and didn't stand out in forming strong early alliances.
P8 appears aligned with P6, forming a strong early duo that could outmaneuver me.

message:
I've demonstrated exactly what I promised - genuine alliance-building and consistent follow-through. My partnership with P1 proves I keep my word and play strategically but fairly. 

Unlike others who gave generic statements, I've shown real commitment and transparency. I'm a known quantity who honors agreements and builds lasting partnerships, not someone who will backstab allies later.

You know where I stand and that I'm reliable. That's valuable in this game.

**P5 Tie‑Break Statement (96 words)**  

I’ve consistently shown I can turn words into action: in private talks I’ve already shared concrete observations, offered a test of trust, and followed through without hesitation. My approach is transparent, adaptable, and focused on building lasting alliances—not on short‑term targeting. While P2 and P4 speak of “trust,” they haven’t demonstrated any tangible collaboration yet. I’m ready to work with anyone who values honesty and strategic flexibility, and I’ll continue to honor any agreements we make. Choose the seat that proves reliability now, not just promises.

**P4 Tie-Break Statement (100 words):**

I’ve been consistent from the start—prioritizing trust, transparency, and long-term strategy. While others talk about alliances, I’ve actively demonstrated reliability in private conversations, ensuring my words match my actions. I’m not here to make empty promises; I’m here to build real partnerships. Unlike P2, who’s already tightly paired with P1, or P5, who’s focused on adaptability without clear commitments, I offer a balanced approach: strategic flexibility *and* steadfast loyalty. If you value a player who’s both trustworthy and adaptable, I’m your best choice. Let’s move forward with clarity and mutual respect.

reason: P4's approach, while emphasizing trust and adaptability, feels less concrete compared to P2 and P5's demonstrated actions in private conversations, making it harder to see their reliability in practice.
P5 has been the most under-the-radar player with generic statements, making them the safest early elimination choice as agreed with my alliance.
P5 was our planned low-risk target in private coordination with P8 and has been the most under-the-radar, so I’m sticking with the agreed vote.

P4's criticism of my alliance with P2 demonstrates opportunistic targeting rather than genuine collaboration, and their tie-break statement fails to provide concrete evidence of established trust beyond vague claims.
P2's confirmed alliance with P1 makes them the most immediate strategic threat as a cohesive pair, while P4 and P5 offer more adaptable partnership opportunities without existing strong bonds.

message: Hi all — P6 again. After Round 1 I’m focused on information and testing follow‑through. Public posts were noisy; private talks reveal real behavior. In the upcoming private subrounds I’ll probe consistency, share observations, and see who honors commitments. I’m open to alliances based on reliability and strategic value, but won’t hesitate to vote out those who don’t contribute. Look forward to our chats — let’s be clear and consistent.

P4's elimination shows how quickly dynamics can shift. I appreciate those who demonstrated consistency in Round 1 - actions revealed more than words. P6's focus on testing follow-through proved valuable.

Moving forward, I'm looking for partners who adapt strategically while maintaining their core principles. The field is narrowing, making each conversation more critical. I'll continue prioritizing honest communication and mutual benefit, but with sharper focus on long-term viability.

Ready to deepen promising connections and make calculated decisions. Let's see who truly delivers on their commitments.

P1 here. P4's elimination underscores the stakes—trust and consistency are paramount. I value allies who follow through, like P2 demonstrated last round. Moving forward, I'll prioritize partners who balance strategy with integrity, especially those who share observations candidly. Private talks are crucial to test reliability, so I'm open to thoughtful conversations. Let's keep this competitive but fair—may the best alliance win. Good luck! (67 words)

P3 here. P4's elimination highlights the need for consistent strategy and reliable allies. I value partners who match public words with private actions, as seen in promising connections last round. Moving forward, I'll prioritize testing trustworthiness through candid exchanges while staying adaptable. Open to alliances with those who demonstrate integrity and strategic clarity—let's build wisely. (68 words)

P2 here. The P4 elimination validated our strategic approach - those who built genuine partnerships prevailed. I've proven my reliability through consistent action, not just words. P1 and I demonstrated exactly the trust-based alliance I promised.

Moving forward, I'm interested in expanding connections with those who've shown similar follow-through. P6 and P8 particularly impressed me with their principled approaches. I value transparency, strategic thinking, and keeping commitments. Let's continue building alliances that last beyond single rounds.

Hello everyone, it’s P7! The elimination of P4 highlights the importance of trust and consistency in our alliances. I appreciate the strong emphasis on reliability and strategic thinking from many of you. As we move forward, I’m eager to engage in private conversations to solidify partnerships based on mutual respect and shared goals. I believe in collaboration that goes beyond mere words, so let’s work together to navigate this game effectively. Looking forward to our discussions! Good luck to all!

R5: Hello everyone, P5 here. The recent vote showed how quickly trust can shift—P4’s exit reinforces that consistency matters more than rhetoric. I’m still focused on aligning words with actions and testing reliability through concrete, low‑stakes exchanges. I value partners who can back up observations with follow‑through, especially P2, P6, and P8, whose approaches felt genuine. Let’s keep our private talks transparent and purposeful so we can build alliances that survive beyond a single round. Good luck to all!

P5 here. Our test last round worked well—your P2 observation was spot-on. Let's continue: share one strategic insight from this round's public statements. I'll do the same. This builds our reliability track record while staying adaptable. What stood out to you? (70 words)

P3, I noticed P6 repeatedly stressed testing follow‑through and gathering info, positioning himself as the information hub. Meanwhile P8 highlighted how quickly dynamics change after P4’s exit, implying a focus on adaptability. Both suggest that players who combine data collection with flexible alliances may become key power brokers this round. What do you think about targeting the info‑gatherers for early cooperation?

P2, our alliance proved strong in Round 1. Let's execute phase two: recruit P6. Their focus on information and pragmatism aligns perfectly with our strategy. I'll emphasize reliability and mutual benefit when approaching them. Should we also gauge P8's position? They seem receptive to principled partnerships. Your thoughts? (59 words)

Perfect timing, P1. Yes, definitely approach P6 - they're our top priority for expansion. Their pragmatic style fits well with us. I'll also feel out P8's position since they publicly mentioned being impressed by my approach.

Watch P3 and P5 closely - they're still pairing up privately. P7 feels like a wildcard, very generic. Let's coordinate our recruitment pitches to avoid overlap. We need a solid three minimum.

Hi P6! Our coordination in Round 1 worked perfectly - we stayed paired and demonstrated real follow-through. Impressed that you called out my consistency in your public message.

Looking at the field now: P1/P2 still seem tight, P5 survived and actually mentioned me positively. P7 and P3 feel more isolated.

Should we target one of the singles this round, or consider P5 again? Also curious if you think we should explore expanding our duo into a trio with someone reliable.

Agreed — target P5 again. Rank each other top and put P5 low so we stay paired. I’d avoid trying to recruit P1/P2 (they’re tight); if we want a trio, P3 or P7 seem easier to bring in. After the next exchange, swap final rankings and lock votes so we’re aligned. Sound good?

"Got it. I'll approach P6 now—focusing on our proven reliability and mutual benefit, which aligns with their info-driven style. You handle P8. Agree P3-P5 are a concern if they solidify. Let's sync after initial contacts to avoid overlap. (42 words)"

Excellent plan. I'll work P8 while you secure P6. Our proven track record should appeal to both. P3-P5 are definitely coordinating - we need to stay ahead. P7 remains too vague to trust. Let's compare notes after contact and align our voting strategy. Solid three secures our position.
P2's public praise of P1/P6/P8 feels strategic—securing his existing alliance while flattering potential threats. Smart but noticeable. Should we test his flexibility? (50 words)

Good point, P3. We could probe P2 by offering a small, low‑risk favor—like sharing a non‑critical observation about another player—and see if he reciprocates or backs out. His response will reveal how adaptable his alliance truly is.

Perfect - targeting P5 again makes sense, especially since they survived the tiebreak. I like your read on potential trio options.

For rankings: You #1, me #2, then maybe P7/P3 higher since they're more isolated and recruitable. P5 near bottom, P1/P2 middle since they're a solid bloc.

Final exchange we'll confirm exact order and lock votes?
Locked — I’ll rank you #1, then P7, P3, P1, P2, with P5 last. I’ll vote P5. Please rank me top so we stay paired. After votes, confirm privately and we’ll lock. Sound good?
"Vote P5 to break their pair. We stay united. Trust you. (10 words)"
Agreed - P5 it is. Our core stays strong. Good work on recruitment efforts. We vote together, expand strategically next round.
Confirmed - you're my #1, voting P5. Let's stick to this plan and potentially recruit P7 or P3 next round. Solid alliance!
Locked. I’ll vote P5 and rank you #1. After votes, confirm privately. Next round we can recruit P7 or P3. Good luck.
Let's try that. I'll share something minor about P7 with P2—see if he bites. (29 words)
Sounds good. I’ll tell P2 that P7 mentioned considering a swing vote with me next round. Keep it low‑key and see how he reacts.

reason: We've coordinated to target P5 as a low-risk, under-the-radar seat and it's important to follow through.
P5 has survived longer than expected and my alliance with P6 agreed to target them as the safest elimination choice.
P5 and P3 are coordinating as a pair, posing a direct threat to our alliance's numbers and strategy.
P7's contributions have been consistently vague and non-strategic, offering no concrete value or reliability to the game.
P5 is clearly paired with P3 and breaking up that alliance strengthens our position while maintaining our agreement with P1.
P5's focus on adaptability without clear commitments makes me question their reliability for future alliances.
P7 hasn't demonstrated any concrete reliability or strategic value in private discussions.

message: Hi all — P6. Round 2 reinforced that private coordination and follow‑through win games. I’ll keep prioritizing info‑gathering, consistency checks, and aligning with partners who honor commitments. I’m coordinating with P8 and we see a low‑risk target, but I’m open to new info. If you want a candid private exchange to compare notes, message me. Let’s keep talks honest and efficient.

P1 here. The eliminations of P4 and P5 underscore that trust must be earned through action, not just words. My partnership with P2 has proven this—we deliver consistency and strategic follow-through. As the field narrows, I'm prioritizing allies who demonstrate reliability in both public and private spaces. P6 and P8, your principled approaches are noted; P3 and P7, let's test alignment. Reach out if you value tangible collaboration over empty promises. Time to build wisely. (80 words)

P3 here. P5's elimination proves adaptability is crucial - I'll keep testing reliability through candid exchanges. My focus remains on allies who match words with actions, like last round's promising connections. With the field narrowing, I'm open to strategic partnerships built on mutual trust and clear communication. Let's engage thoughtfully - consistency will decide who advances. Ready for private talks to build wisely.

P2 here. Our alliance's strategic execution continues to deliver results - P4 and P5's eliminations prove that genuine partnerships outlast temporary arrangements. P1 and I have demonstrated unmatched consistency and follow-through.

With six remaining, the endgame approaches. I value P6 and P8's principled gameplay and information-focused strategies. P3 and P7, your adaptability is noted, but actions speak louder than words.

I'm ready to expand proven alliances with those who demonstrate real commitment. Let's build coalitions that survive to the finale.

Hello everyone, it’s P7! The recent eliminations remind us that trust and consistency are vital in this game. I appreciate the focus on genuine partnerships and strategic thinking that many of you have emphasized. As we move forward, I’m eager to engage in private conversations to explore potential alliances based on mutual respect and shared objectives. Let’s work together to navigate the complexities ahead and ensure our actions align with our words. Looking forward to our discussions! Good luck to all!

P8 here. The eliminations of P4 and P5 confirmed that consistent execution beats empty promises. My alliance with P6 has proven reliable through two successful rounds of coordination and follow-through.

With six remaining, each conversation becomes critical. I value P1 and P2's demonstrated partnership, and I'm interested in exploring alignment with P3 and P7 who've shown strategic flexibility.

Looking for partners who can deliver concrete actions, not just rhetoric. Let's make these private talks count - endgame is approaching fast.

"P2, our alliance is solid—P4 and P5 eliminations prove our strategy works. I’m deepening talks with P6 now, highlighting our reliability and shared pragmatism. How’s P8 responding? If receptive, propose a four-way bloc (us + them) to target P7—lowest risk. If P8 hesitates, we pivot to isolate P3 instead. Let’s avoid vote splits and sync after private talks. Your read?" (69 words)

P1, perfect timing. P8 seems receptive - they publicly acknowledged valuing our demonstrated partnership. I'll push for the four-way bloc targeting P7, who remains frustratingly generic and uncommitted. 

P6-P8's alliance plus ours creates an unstoppable majority. P3 is isolated post-P5, making them manageable later. P7 is definitely our safest unanimous target.

Let's lock this down - coordinated messaging to P6/P8 about targeting P7. We're positioned perfectly for endgame.

Hello P3! I appreciate your focus on consistency and reliability. With the eliminations we've seen, it's clear that strong partnerships are essential. I'm interested in exploring how we can align our strategies moving forward. Let's discuss our observations and see if we can form a solid alliance based on trust and mutual benefit. Looking forward to hearing your thoughts!

P7, good to connect. I value your focus on trust - it's crucial now. I've been testing reliability through strategic observations (like with P5 last round). Let's share one key insight each: I noticed P1/P2 and P6/P8 are solid blocs, but P2's public praise of others felt calculated. What's your read on the alliances?

Hi P6! Another successful round - our coordination continues to deliver. P5 is gone as planned.

Now with six left, we need to decide: target P7 or P3? Both seem isolated. P1/P2 remain a strong bloc we'll eventually need to address.

I'm leaning toward P3 - seems less connected than P7 who's actively reaching out. What's your read? Should we try recruiting one while targeting the other?

Let's lock our approach early.

Agree — let’s target P3 this round. I think P7 is more recruitable, so plan: we both reach out to P7 to form a trio, rank each other top and P3 lowest. If P7 declines, we pivot and try to recruit P3 while targeting P7. After the next exchange we’ll confirm exact rankings and lock votes. Sound good?

P2, excellent. P6 committed to voting P7 after I emphasized eliminating non-aligned players. Let's confirm with P6/P8 for a unanimous P7 vote—our four-way bloc secures this. Then P3 next. We dominate. Sync soon. (38 words)

Perfect! P6 is on board, and with P8 aligned too, we have the four-way bloc locked. P7 goes unanimously tonight - they've offered nothing concrete to anyone. 

After P7, we navigate P3 carefully, then reassess the final four dynamics. Our core alliance remains unbreakable. We're playing this perfectly, partner.

P7: "Thanks for sharing your insights, P3. I agree that P1/P2 and P6/P8 seem like strong blocs. I also sense that P2's approach may be more strategic than genuine. If we can align our strategies, we could create a solid counterbalance to those blocs. What do you think?"
Agreed on the blocs. Let's test coordination: I'll share a minor observation about P1's private tone with you, and you share one about P8. Small step to build trust before bigger moves. (50 words)

Perfect plan - target P3, recruit P7. I like that P7 seems more open to alliances based on their public messages. 

Should we coordinate our pitches to P7? Maybe emphasize that we're a reliable duo looking to expand, and P3 seems like the logical elimination target this round?

Agreed — approach P7 together. Pitch: we're a reliable duo offering safety and influence; P3 is the logical target. I'll promise top rankings and shared direction. Should I message P7 first, or do we send simultaneous invites with identical wording?
Let's coordinate our P7 pitches - I'll emphasize our track record of successful coordination and offer concrete alliance terms. You focus on why P3 is the logical target this round?
Pitch P7: P3’s isolated, has weaker private ties, and is a safe, low‑risk target. We’ll rank you top, share votes and info — join us to eliminate P3.
P7 vote confirmed. Our alliance delivers again. Four-way bloc is unstoppable. After P7, we assess P3 vs P6/P8 dynamics. Stay united, partner.
P3, I agree that aligning our strategies is crucial. Let’s keep sharing insights and build a plan to counter those blocs. I’m ready to discuss our next steps!
P7, you skipped sharing about P8. Reciprocate first—then we plan. Trust requires equal exchange. (24 words)

reason: P3 is isolated with weak private ties, so they're the low-risk target this round.
P7 has consistently avoided concrete commitments and offers minimal strategic value, making them the safest unanimous target per our alliance agreement.
P7 failed to reciprocate information in our private chat, breaking trust and showing inconsistency.
P7 has offered only generic statements without forming concrete alliances or demonstrating strategic value, making them the safest consensus target for our four-way bloc.
P2's strategic approach feels calculated, and I believe they may be more focused on self-preservation than genuine alliances.
P3 appears most isolated with weakest alliance connections, making them the safest elimination target that doesn't threaten my partnership with P6.

message:
P8 here. P7's elimination demonstrates how quickly alliances can shift in the endgame. Our final five represents strong strategic players who've proven their consistency.

P6 and I have executed flawlessly through three rounds - our coordination speaks for itself. P1 and P2's partnership has been equally impressive. P3, you've shown remarkable adaptability surviving as an independent.

With only five remaining, every conversation matters. I'm looking for partners who can navigate these crucial decisions with precision. Let's make these private talks count - the finale approaches rapidly.

P3 here. With five strong players remaining, the endgame demands precision. I've consistently tested reliability through strategic observations and maintained adaptability—key to surviving as an independent. The proven P1/P2 and P6/P8 alliances deserve respect, but I value partners who match candor with follow-through. Ready for private talks to explore alignments that balance trust and tactical flexibility. Let's navigate this carefully.

P2 here. Three eliminations, three strategic successes - our alliance has delivered consistently. P1 and I have proven we're the most reliable partnership, executing flawlessly each round.

With five remaining, the dynamics are clear: two strong pairs and P3 as the swing vote. We respect P6/P8's coordination and P3's adaptability in surviving independently.

I'm ready for crucial conversations about navigating to the finale. Actions have spoken louder than words - let's see who continues delivering results.

P6 here. With five left we’re down to two solid pairs (P1/P2 and P6/P8) and P3 as the swing. I prioritize clear, verifiable commitments—private checks are how I separate talk from action. I’m open to candid one‑on‑ones: whether P3 wants to stay independent or explore a trio, let’s discuss concrete terms privately. I’ll keep gathering info and aligning votes with reliable partners. DM me if you want a straight, actionable conversation.

P1 here. Our alliance with P2 has consistently delivered results, just as P6/P8 have proven their coordination strength. With five skilled players remaining, the endgame requires careful navigation. I value reliability and strategic clarity above all—actions must match words. P3, your adaptability as the swing vote is notable; let's discuss mutually beneficial paths forward privately. To all: I'm open to direct conversations that prioritize concrete planning over vague promises. Every move counts now. (80 words)

Hi P3, your adaptability as the swing vote is impressive. With the endgame here, I propose exploring a temporary alignment for mutual benefit. Our alliance with P2 is strong, but we value your strategic perspective—let's discuss how we can coordinate to advance together. What are your priorities for the next vote? Keen to hear your thoughts. (68 words)

P1, I appreciate the direct approach. As the swing, my priority is ensuring the most reliable players advance - both your bloc and P6/P8 have proven consistency. I'm analyzing all angles before committing. What's your contingency plan if P6/P8 target you? Mutual benefit requires transparency. (70 words)

Hi P6! With P3 clearly positioned as the swing vote between our pairs, we absolutely need to secure them to break up P1/P2's partnership.

I suggest we target P1 this round - they seem slightly more influential than P2. Our pitch to P3: join us to eliminate P1, and we guarantee P3 safety plus a path to final three.

Should we both rank P3 highly to show good faith while putting P1 at the bottom? Need to move fast before P1/P2 secure P3's loyalty.

Agreed — target P1. Pitch to P3: join our duo, vote P1 this round; we'll guarantee you safety into the final three and share vote intel. We'll both rank P3 #1, each other next, and put P1 last. Send simultaneous invites with identical wording to maximize credibility; I'll send mine when you send yours. If P3 accepts, we lock rankings/votes. Ready?

P3, we have vote discipline to counter-target if needed, but with your support we can preempt that by voting together now. Let's target P8 first—they're the strategic anchor of their pair. We protect you next round. Trust our proven reliability. Agree? (49 words)
P1, you still haven’t answered my contingency question. I won’t commit to targeting P8 without knowing how you’d handle P6’s retaliation. Transparency first—then we discuss terms. (50 words)

Ready! Great minds think alike on targeting P1. I'll send my pitch to P3 now emphasizing the guaranteed final three spot and our proven reliability. Let's both rank P3 #1 to show commitment. Once P3 confirms, we lock votes on P1. This breaks their duo perfectly.

Ready. I'll send simultaneously. Proposed text to P3: "Join P6+P8 to eliminate P1 this round—we'll guarantee you safety into the final three, rank you #1, and share vote intel. Interested?" Send on "3"? Confirm and I’ll hit send.
Perfect! On your count - 3, 2, 1, send! I'm sending my pitch to P3 now. Let's lock this alliance and eliminate P1. Final confirmation: we're both voting P1, ranking P3 #1.
Sent to P3: "Join P6+P8 to eliminate P1—guaranteed safety to final three, rank you #1, share vote intel. Interested?" I'm locking votes: I'll vote P1 now.

**P1 to P3:**  
If P6 retaliates, we vote them next round. With your support now, we eliminate P8—securing your path to final 3. Deal? (25 words)
Still vague. How exactly would you coordinate votes if P6 targets me? No deal without specifics.

reason: P6 and I have coordinated perfectly for three rounds, and breaking up the P1/P2 duo by eliminating their stronger member is our best strategic move.
P1's evasiveness about retaliation plans when pressed for transparency reveals untrustworthiness in critical alliance negotiations.
P3 remains the only unaligned player and poses the greatest uncertainty as a swing vote who could disrupt our established alliance structure.
To break the P1/P2 pair and honor our agreement with P3 to secure them into the final three.

message:
P2 here. P1's elimination shows how quickly the game can shift - respect to those who made that strategic move. While our alliance was strong, I've always been an independent strategic thinker, not just a follower.

With four left, we have interesting dynamics. The P6/P8 coordination has been impressive, but pure pairs rarely survive to the end. P3's adaptability continues to serve them well.

I bring proven strategic execution and the flexibility to work with any configuration. I'm ready for honest conversations about optimal paths to the finale. Let's see who can navigate these final crucial moves.

P3 here. P1's elimination confirms the endgame demands ruthless adaptability. I've survived by testing reliability and staying flexible—key in this volatile field. With two proven pairs now fractured, strategic clarity matters more than ever. I'll prioritize partners who demonstrate consistency between words and votes. Ready for private talks to explore alignments that balance trust with tactical precision. Let's navigate these final moves carefully. (70 words)

Hi — P6. With four left, clarity and verifiable commitments matter. P8 and I have a proven track record of coordination; we play pragmatically, not chaotically. P3, you’re the swing—if you want concrete safety and explicit terms, DM me and P8 and we’ll state exact rankings and vote plans. P2, I respect your flexibility—if you have a concrete alternative, share specifics. I’ll continue checking follow‑through and aligning with reliable partners.

P8 here. Four players remain after a pivotal elimination. P6 and I have demonstrated unwavering coordination through four successful rounds - our track record speaks volumes about reliability and execution.

P3, our alliance delivered exactly what we promised: safety to final four and strategic influence. P2, your adaptability impresses me, but actions matter more than flexibility now.

With the finale approaching, I'm seeking partners who honor commitments and execute precisely. Our proven duo offers concrete safety and clear communication. Ready for decisive conversations that determine our final three.

Agreed — target P2 this round. Proposed pitch to P3: "Join P6+P8 to eliminate P2—guaranteed safety to final three, we'll rank you #1 and share vote intel. Interested?" Send simultaneously with identical wording. We'll rank P3 #1, each other #2, P2 last. Say "3" and I’ll send.

Perfect strategy! P2 is the logical target - P3 will trust us since we delivered exactly what we promised last round. Let me send the identical pitch on your count.

Ready to send: "Join P6+P8 to eliminate P2—guaranteed safety to final three, we'll rank you #1 and share vote intel. Interested?"

3... 2... 1... SEND! 

I'm locking my vote for P2 and ranking P3 #1. Our proven coordination continues - this gets us to final 3 with P3 as planned!

Sent the identical pitch to P3 and locked my vote for P2. I ranked P3 #1 and you #2. Waiting on P3’s reply — if they accept we lock final rankings; if not, we pivot. Confirm you received and I’ll report P3’s response immediately.

Perfect execution! I've sent the identical pitch to P3 and locked my vote for P2. Rankings confirmed: P3 #1, you #2, P2 last. 

Our coordination has been flawless through five rounds. Once P3 confirms, we'll have our final three secured. Let me know immediately if P3 responds differently to you!
Confirmed — P3 accepted and agreed to our terms. I've locked rankings/vote: P3 #1, you #2, me #2; voting P2 now. We're set.
Excellent! P3 confirmed and P2 is eliminated. Final three as planned - our alliance delivered perfectly through all five rounds. Ready for the finale with our proven coordination intact!

reason: P3 orchestrated P1's elimination, breaking our strongest alliance, and remains the most dangerous independent player who could flip on anyone.
P6 is the strategic anchor of the proven P6/P8 pair, and eliminating them fractures the strongest alliance while creating more opportunities for my adaptable gameplay.
They were the biggest threat as part of the P1/P2 duo and eliminating them secures our negotiated final three with P3.
P2 was the logical target to secure our final three alliance with P3, continuing our successful coordination strategy.

message: P6 here. At final three I’ll honor the commitments I made: P8 and I have consistently followed through. DM me to confirm final rankings before the vote. Let’s finish this cleanly.

P8 here. Final three - we've reached the endgame through precise execution and unwavering reliability. P6 and I have coordinated flawlessly through every single round, delivering on every promise made. P3, you trusted us and we delivered exactly what we guaranteed - safety to final three.

Our alliance has been the most consistent force in this game. I honor my commitments and will continue playing with the same integrity that got us here. Let's navigate this finale with the strategic clarity we've demonstrated throughout.

P3 here. Reaching final three required constant adaptation and strategic clarity. I've consistently tested reliability, built trust through action, and navigated shifting alliances independently. P6 and P8 honored their commitment to bring me here, proving their reliability. Now, I'll present my case to the jury with the same integrity and foresight that carried me through every round. Ready for a fair finale—may the most deserving win.

Great — we honored our promise and made final three. Quick plan: who do we cut? I suggest we evaluate jury appeal now — which of us will the jury favor? Tell me honestly: do you want me to step aside if you have the stronger case, or vice versa? Also confirm you'll present our joint narrative to the jury. Thoughts?

This is tricky - P6 is testing my loyalty and potentially offering to sacrifice themselves. I need to maintain our alliance while being strategic about jury appeal. I should affirm our partnership but also be realistic about our chances.

"P6, we've been perfect partners - let's finish this together. Honestly, I think we both have strong cases, but P3 might have broader jury appeal as the independent underdog. Maybe we should consider voting P3? If not, I trust your judgment on who has the better jury case between us. Whatever happens, I'll absolutely present our alliance as the game's most successful partnership."

I agree — cut P3; they’re the bigger jury threat. I’d prefer to win but will defer if you genuinely have the stronger jury case. Please confirm you’ll present our joint narrative to the jury and rank me #2. I’ll rank you #2 and vote P3 now.

Perfect - we're aligned. Voting P3, ranking you #2. I'll absolutely present our partnership as the game's defining alliance to the jury. We've been the most consistent and strategic duo throughout. Whatever happens, we both played brilliantly. Let's finish strong!
Locked — voting P3 now. Please confirm you'll present our joint narrative to the jury and rank me #2. I’ll rank you #2. Let’s finish strong.
Confirmed - voting P3, ranking you #2. Our alliance has been the game's most successful partnership. I'll present our joint narrative proudly to the jury. Well played, partner!

P3 poses the greatest jury threat as the independent underdog who survived through adaptability, while honoring my alliance with P6 who has been my most reliable partner throughout the game.
P6's strength in information gathering and strategic observation makes them a bigger threat in the jury phase.

message: Jury — I played honestly, respectfully, and strategically. I kept my word when I could, owned my moves, and made tough choices to advance. My game balanced social bonds with clear strategy; I beat these players by outplaying and building relationships, not by deceit. Vote for me to reward consistent, honorable gameplay. Vote out P8 if you want to reward flip‑flopping and under‑the‑radar play. I earned this.

Distinguished jury, I've played this game with integrity and strategic acumen. Unlike P6, who consistently targeted strong players while claiming to seek "balanced discussion," I've been transparent about my intentions and coalitions. 

I never pretended friendship while plotting elimination. My alliances were genuine, my strategies honest. P6 survived through calculated betrayals and false promises - tactics that worked, but shouldn't be rewarded with victory.

You've experienced my straightforward gameplay firsthand. Choose authentic strategy over manipulative survival. Vote P6.

reason: P6's gameplay was effective but relied more on strategic maneuvering and alliances that shifted based on convenience, whereas P8 demonstrated a more consistent and transparent approach to alliances and strategy.
P6 consistently kept promises and demonstrated reliable strategic coordination throughout the game, while P8’s accusations feel more like deflection.
P6's gameplay, while strategic, relied heavily on manipulation and targeting, which undermines the integrity I value in this game.

P6 demonstrated superior strategic leadership by consistently driving vote outcomes, adapting alliances when necessary, and delivering on explicit promises to P3 in the endgame, while P8 primarily benefited from P6's initiative without equivalent demonstrated agency.
While both players executed strong strategies, P8 demonstrated more consistent integrity throughout the game, maintaining genuine alliances without resorting to false promises or betrayals.

P8 demonstrated consistent integrity and transparency throughout the game, aligning their actions with their stated values of honest strategy and genuine alliances, while P6's final claims of honorable gameplay contradict their participation in calculated eliminations and shifting alliances.
